message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public Integer sillyExample(Collection<Integer> collection){
    if(collection != null && !collection.isEmpty()){
        return collection.iterator().next();
    }
    return null;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Iterator.next() method is used to retrieve the next element in a collection. In your case, since you know there is only one element in the collection, you can directly use this method to get that element. You should also check if the collection is not null and not empty before trying to retrieve an element to avoid NullPointerException or NoSuchElementException.
